children.name: perfect a2
children.definition: perfect sb/sth that is perfect is good in every way and could not be any better: hoàn hảo
examples: ▪ we had a wonderful vacation - the weather was perfect.
in a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
be in perfect healthuse this especially about someone who is old
▪ my mother’s in perfect health, even though she’s nearly 80.
the perfect husband/secretary/couple etc
▪ beth and martin always seemed to be the perfect couple.
absolutely perfecthis sight is absolutely perfect.
quite perfectwritten(= absolutely perfect )the old bottle was very dark blue and quite perfect.
almost/nearly/near perfecthis collection included an almost perfect skeleton of an armadillo.|her performance was near perfect.
less than perfect(= not perfect )so many excellent writers, for example byron and keats, were less than perfect spellers.
far from perfect(= not at all perfect )the weather conditions were far from perfect.
technically perfectthe system was technically perfect.
perfection[u] c1 the state of being perfect :
don’t expect perfection in your relationships.
my father expected perfection from all of us.
the search for technical perfection
to perfection(= perfectly )
the pasta was cooked to perfection.

children.name: faultless c2
children.definition: faultless/flawless c2  formal completely perfect, with no mistakes or faults at all: hoàn mỹ hoàn hảo
examples: hiroshi’s english was flawless.
he gave a faultless performance as macbeth.
his english was flawless.|a faultless performance

children.name: impeccable x
children.definition: impeccable formal so good that you cannot find anything wrong with it – used especially about someone’s behaviour, taste, or experience: hoàn hảo, không chê vào đâu được
examples: impeccable manners/behaviour/taste etc
macdonald was an aristocratic character with impeccable manners
as i expected, her house was decorated with impeccable taste.
impeccable qualifications/credentialsdocuments that show that your experience or skills are perfect for a particular job or situation
on paper, her qualifications seemed to be impeccable.
impeccably[adv] một cách hoàn hảo
gary came in, impeccably dressed in a dark blue suit.
there was a long church service, but the kids managed to behave impeccably.

children.name: can’t fault x
children.definition: can’t fault say you can’t fault sth, when you cannot criticize it because it has no faults or mistakes: không thể chê trách được gì
examples: ▪ i can’t fault her driving, except that it’s rather fast.
▪ no one could fault the way he handled the crisis.

children.name: unblemished x
children.definition: unblemished describes a reputation, character, etc. that has no faults and is not spoiled in any way: “không nhơ nhuốc, ô uế”
examples: for six years his championship record was unblemished.
the report stated that stewart’s character had remained completely unblemished.
an unblemished reputation/record/past etc
mrs falconer had an unblemished record of 27 years service with the company.
he has established an unblemished reputation for accuracy.

children.name: the best and most suitable person or thing
ideal b2
children.definition: ideal very suitable and exactly what you want: lí tưởng
examples: advice on how to reach your ideal weight
the scheme offers anideal opportunityfor youngsters to get training.
with so much rain, conditions are far from ideal.
ideal for
an elastic waist makes these jeans ideal for the larger woman.
an ideal place for a walk
it’s a very relaxed hotel, ideal for families with young children.
sb’s ideal man/woman/job/house etcone that has all the qualities you like best
my ideal man would be someone like mel gibson.

children.name: perfect b1
children.definition: perfect exactly what is needed for a particular purpose, situation, or personsyn ideal: hoàn hảo
examples: that’s perfect! just the way i wanted it to look.
crusty bread is the perfect accompaniment to this soup.
perfect for
the land is perfect for sheep farming.
perfect way/place/time etc to do something
she thought she’d found the perfect place to live.
perfect day/place/person etc for something
a perfect day for a picnic
the perfect actor for the part

children.name: just right b1
children.definition: just rightespecially spokensuitable in every way:
examples: ‘do these new curtains look ok?’ ‘yes, they’re just right.’
just right for
i’m glad they’re getting married - they’re just right for each other.
the weather was just right for a day at the beach.|the dress is just right for you.

children.name: be just the thing x
children.definition: be just the thingalsobe just the jobuk  informal to be exactly what is needed: thích hợp,
examples: cold lemonade is just the thing on a hot day.
he’s just the person for the job.
be just the thing for
a tall hedge would be just the job for that side of the garden.

children.name: tailor-made x
children.definition: tailor-made/ˌteɪləʳ ˈmeɪd◂/  specially designed for you, so that it is exactly what you need or want: hoàn toàn thích hợp
examples: ▪ if you are an independent traveller, we can arrange a tailor-made tour.
nếu bạn là người du lịch độc lập, chúng ta có thể sắp xếp lịch trình phù hợp
tailor-made for phù hợp với
▪ our company can provide you with an insurance policy that is tailor-made for you.
công ty chúng tôi có thể cung cấp cho bạn một hợp đồng bảo hiểm phù hợp với bạn
tailor-made to do something: thích hợp để làm gì đó
▪ in the usa and canada, a house is often tailor-made to fit the needs of the family that will live in it.
ở mỹ và canada, ngôi nhà thường phù hợp với nhu cầu của các thành viên sống trong đó

children.name: perfect c2
children.definition: perfect/pəʳˈfekt/  hoàn thiện
examples: ▪ the only way to perfect your accent is to go and live in france
▪ james was out on the ski slope, trying to perfect his short turns.
▪ this technique was perfected by the ancient egyptians.
perfect the art/technique of (doing) sth
▪ after eighteen years of marriage to gemma, ronald had perfected the art of keeping the peace.

children.name: bring sth to perfection x
children.definition: bring sth to perfection written to make something perfect over a long period of time, especially when this takes a lot of care, practice, or skill:
examples: ▪ keeping the wine in a cool place for five years will bring it to perfection.
▪ it requires considerable practise to bring the skill of weaving to perfection.

children.name: ways of saying what you would like to happen if everything was perfect
ideally b2
children.definition: ideally use this when saying what you would like to happen if everything was perfect: lí tưởng
examples: ▪ ideally, we’d like to provide regular training for everyone.
▪ in order to win, you must throw your opponent, ideally onto his back.

children.name: in an ideal world b2
children.definition: in an ideal world/in a perfect world use this to say what would happen if the situation were perfect, even though you know that the situation can never be perfect: một tình huống, cuộc sống lí tưởng
examples: ▪ in an ideal world we would be recycling and reusing everything.
▪ of course, in an ideal world there would be no war.

children.name: imperfect c1
children.definition: imperfect formal not completely correct or perfect: không hoàn hảo, không trọn vẹn
examples: ▪ imperfect goods are sold off cheaply.
▪ in general, people have a very imperfect knowledge of the law.
▪ you have to accept that most relationships are imperfect.
▪ she has anxieties and fears, like anyone else in this imperfect world.

children.name: flawed c2
children.definition: flawed  sth such as a plan, idea, or system that is flawed, has a fault which prevents it from working as well as it should do: không hoàn thiện, có sai sót
examples: ▪ each party rejected the other’s approach, saying it was flawed.
▪ flawed logic: logic sai lầm
▪ the results are based on flawed interpretations of the data.
a flawed concept
fatally/fundamentally/deeply etc flawed
the research behind this report is seriously flawed.
▪ birch’s analysis of the situation was deeply flawed.

children.name: perfectly b1
children.definition: perfectly/ˈpɜːʳfɪktli/  một cách hoàn hảo
examples: ▪ the coffee machine seems to work perfectly now.
▪ he was perfectly dressed in a dark suit and tie.
▪ after two years in spain, kate spoke the language perfectly.

children.name: to perfection x
children.definition: to perfection/tə pəʳˈfekʃən/  if something happens, or has been done to perfection, it is perfect and you are very pleased with it: đến sự hoàn hảo
examples: ▪ marge tried on the dress and it fitted to perfection.
▪ by september the apples had ripened to perfection.

children.name: perfect as an idea, but impossible in reality
ideal b2
children.definition: ideal an ideal world, job, system etc is one that you imagine to be perfect, but that is not likely to really existsyn perfect: lý tưởng
examples: plato dreamed of an ideal society.
a completely new kitchen would be ideal, but i don’t think that we can afford it.
in an ideal worldthere would be no need for a police force.
ideal[c] the ideal of something
the ideal of equality:

children.name: utopian x
children.definition: utopian autopian society is one in which you imagine there is a perfect social or political situation, although this is unlikely to ever really exist: không tưởng,
examples: ▪ the debate was about the impossibility of a utopian society.
a utopian dreamwhen you think about and wish for utopian society : giấc mơ không tưởng
▪ marxism was a utopian dream.

children.name: idealized x
children.definition: idealizedalsoidealisedbritish /aɪˈdɪəlaɪzd/  an idealized view or description of something considers or shows it as perfect when really it is not: lí tưởng hóa
examples: ▪ i think you have an idealized idea of what a doctor does.
▪ the film showed an idealized view of rural life in the nineteenth century.
▪ an idealized image of motherhood

children.name: to think that sb or st is perfect when they are not
idealize x
children.definition: idealizealsoidealisebritish /aɪˈdɪəlaɪz/  to consider or show someone or something as perfect, without noticing their faults: lí tưởng hóa
examples: ▪ people often idealize the past.
▪ she always idealized her father, who had died when she was five.

children.name: put sb on a pedestal x
children.definition: put sb on a pedestal to wrongly think that someone is perfect so that you are unable to treat them as an ordinary person: thần tượng hóa, tôn thờ hóa
examples: ▪ it’s very common for men to put women they love on a pedestal.

children.name: can do no wrong u
children.definition: can do no wrong if one person thinks that another person can do no wrong, they think they are perfect, even though they really do have faults:
examples: ▪ whatever trouble eddy gets into, mum still thinks he can do no wrong,
▪ of course, the fans believe that the players can do no wrong.

children.name: sb who isn't satisfied with anything
perfectionist x
children.definition: perfectionist someone who is not satisfied with anything unless it is completely perfect: người cầu toàn
examples: ▪ mart kenney was a perfectionist, and his high standards were an example to everyone else.
▪ she worked carefully on her drawing, with all the attention to detail of the perfectionist.
